results.title: Every day a challenge
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Penny Gurr who has multiple sclerosis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia

results.title: Just one of those things (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James Burge, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dependent Future Pt. 1”.
A film about the hopes, joys and fears of a group of mentally handicapped children and their parents. They live in Swadlincote in Derbyshire where since 1971 all mentally handicapped children have been educated in ordinary schools

results.title: Rational suicide
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “60 Minutes”.
To some perfectly rational people afflicted with pain and incurable disease, rational suicide has become a real and plausible option. Others believe that you don’t have to kill the patient to kill the pain. The film examines both sides of the argument, including an interview with a man who assisted his terminally ill wife in taking her own life.

results.title: In the mainstream
results.creator_credit: Carousel Films and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “60 Minutes”.
Examines the new law in the United States whereby handicapped children must wherever possible, be mainstreamed, that is, educated in the classroom along with other children. Looks at how the new law is working - successful in some cases but a failure in others

results.title: Herpes: 400,000 new cases each year
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “60 Minutes”.
Describes the physical symptoms and consequences of the disease as well as the emotional trauma it can trigger. Groups of sufferers relate their feelings of hurt, bewilderment, anger and so discuss a highly sensitive and topical subject.

results.title: Can we live to be 100?
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Donald, Isaac Kleinerman, James Jackson, Peter Poor and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “21st Century”.
At the National Institute of Health in Baltimore, researchers are trying to find answers to the question of extending life. Scientists are studying microscopic creatures called rotifers whose life span has been increased by a drastic change of environment. The possibility that this might be an effective program for human life is the problem posed in the survey. the film also discusses organ transplanting, germ-free isolation for patients, freezing the dead or incurable for possible revival and experiments on the aging process.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jonathan Donald, Isaac Kleinerman, James Jackson, Peter Poor and Columbia Broadcasting System
